page.title: 10ENERGY
page.content: Elsecar Colliery Coal has been the major source of employment and reason for the growth of the village of Elsecar since the 1800s.The "Planting Pit" or Simon Wood colliery closed in 1903 and High Elsecar Pit which was part of Elsecar old Colliery closed in 1888.Elsecar main colliery was begun in July 1905 and continued producing coal until 1983-the last time coal was mined in Elsecar.The pit head buildings of Elsecar Main Colliery remained standing until the winter of 1984 when extensive demoliton began.The colliery chimney which had been the landmark of Elsecar was finaly demolished on Wednesday 27th February 1985.
